sentences.english: There you will offer yourselves for sale to your enemies as male and female slaves, but no one will buy you.
sentences.chinese: 在那里你必卖己身与仇敌作奴婢，却无人买。

sentences.english: The cause that Emperor Wu of the Northern Zhou Dynasty released slaves was both human factor and objective factor.
sentences.chinese: 北周武帝释放奴婢，既有人为因素，也有客观因素。

sentences.english: In the black of night this one heard you scream.
sentences.chinese: 在漆黑掂旃里奴婢听到您尖叫。

sentences.english: I think I am lucky just to get to see him in person.
sentences.chinese: 对奴婢来说能看到皇上就已经是大幸了。

sentences.english: Chapter one discusses the definition and regimentation of slaves.
sentences.chinese: 第一章讨论了奴婢的定义和类别问题。

definition: (literary) I, your servant (self-appellation of a lower-rank female)/(archaic) male and female slaves/subjects (of a ruler)
(old) your servant (humble self-reference by young female)
lord/master/young gentleman/male prostitute/catamite/mahjong player disqualified by unintentionally taking in the wrong number of dominoes/(old form of address for one's husband) husband
the emperor/Your majesty the emperor/His imperial majesty
